Chanag nyangar

I was 37 then, strapped in my seat as the huge 747 plunged through dense cloud cover on approach to Hamburg airport. Cold November rains drenched the earth, lending everything the gloomy air of a Flemish landscape: the ground crew in waterproofs, a flag atop a squat airport building, a BMW billboard. So - Germany again. Once the plane was on the ground, soft music began to flow from the ceiling speakers: a sweet orchestral cover version of the Beatles' "Norwegian Wood". The melody never failed to send a shudder through me, but this time it hit me harder than ever.

Robert Beattie
1 month ago
Don't know why this popped-up in my YouTube feed, but I'm glad it did. And I'm grateful to you for posting your cover. Triggered a memory from 1974, when I finished writing my first novel. I worked until 1:23 am at Cessna Aircraft Company Factory Prospect Plant. Typically, I'd be home and start writing in my garage around 3 AM, write until 6 AM. Typewriter clackity-clacking was noisy, so I couldn't type in the house while the rest of the family was sleeping. On my way home one night I bought an album of Beatles songs and played it on an adjacent phonograph while I was at my typewriter. (Yes, we had 24-hour stores in 1974, even in Wichita, Kansas.) The album stuck on Norwegian Wood, so I'd hear Norwegian Wood over and over and over. Sometimes I'd reach over and move the needle, but not often. (And yes, commerce was commerce and they sold all manner of variations of Beatles songs in compilations. I recall that I bought this one because it had Paperback Writer, even though I ended up listening mostly to Norwegian Wood.) Eventually I became a paperback writer. Robert Beattie, New York Times bestselling author.

I worked until 1:23 am at Cessna Aircraft Company Factory Prospect Plant. Typically, I'd be home and start writing in my garage around 3 AM, write until 6 AM. Typewriter clackity-clacking was noisy, so I couldn't type in the house while the rest of the family was sleeping. On my way home one night I bought an album of Beatles songs and played it on an adjacent phonograph while I was at my typewriter. (Yes, we had 24-hour stores in 1974, even in Wichita, Kansas.) The album stuck on Norwegian Wood, so I'd hear Norwegian Wood over and over and over. Sometimes I'd reach over and move the needle, but not often. (And yes, commerce was commerce and they sold all manner of variations of Beatles songs in compilations. I recall that I bought this one because it had Paperback Writer, even though I ended up listening mostly to Norwegian Wood.) Eventually I became a paperback writer. I heard this song 30yrs ago when I was a child. I was sick, had chicken pox , and was listening to an oldies station when I went to bed. It's one of those inconsequential moments in your life that for some reason never forget. The "Hop on the bus Gus, don't need to discuss much" line has stuck in my head my entire life, having never heard the song again after that night. Finally, 30yrs later the line popped into my head again and I finally searched and found this song. I feel like I was teleported back to my childhood bedroom as a 7yr old kid as soon as this song started playing. The human mind is a funny thing sometimes.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: THIS SONG IS STILL A PURE CLASSIC AFTER 47 YEARS.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: My mom used to turn this song up when it would come on the radio and sing along like she had a memory instilled deeply within her that was important, or dear to her. The last time I broke it off with a girl before meeting my wife of 12 years now I walked to my car, turned the key, and this song played upon the radio. A song and memory unlocked to me as of recent that I had forgotten.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: I was in a horrible abusive relationship. Trapped in a country with no family or friends. Too long a story...ha! I used to listen to this song at night while I tried to mastermind a way out. I made it out and this song makes me so happy. My freedom song!

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: Paul Simon probably has the most soothing voice in all rock and roll history, even daring to give him higher than Paul McCartney

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: This song was really ahead of its time,   in that it acknowledged that men could be stuck in toxic relationships as well as women and also had the right to tell someone and leave.  Also, it's fun and catchy as hell.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: god i love how genuine the delivery of the "I appreciate that" line at 2:05 sounds.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments:
Lyrics

The problem is all inside your head, she said to me

The answer is easy if you take it logically

I'd like to help you in your struggle to be free

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: Here after Paul Davis made me appreciate the chord progression!

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: My parents divorced when I was 9. I spent every other weekend with my dad but being a daddy's girl, it was never enough for me. He was a big Paul Simon fan and we sang along to his music in dad's car every Sunday when he took me to my mom's. This was always my favorite of all the songs and now that my dad is gone, it always reminds me of him. Thank you for uploading it!

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: I'm only 26, but this song has helped me through two heartbreaking break-ups. Whenever I felt sad, I would just dance to this..and I got myself free.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: That damn drum line is iconic

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: The lyrics are dope. The drummer awesome. The guitar...AWESOME

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: My favorite drum intro on any song ever made. Masterpiece by Steve Gadd. Came here because it's Steve's birthday, and wanted to listen to one of his best.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: Nearly fifty years on still sounds as cool as ever.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: the drum  role on this song is dope

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: You don't get many artists covering Paul Simon songs, he has a unique voice, prob one of greatest composers ever

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: This song means so much to me. I am about to 29 this Halloween... But when I was in highschool, it was like my "bestfriend" song with my homie. We just loved it so much like all classic music. But we were particularly fond of this one... Unfortunately my bestfriend passed away coming to my house my senior year in a car accident. But you know what was weird? Is that this song came on the radio when I was driving to the funeral. Of course I busted into tears. At the same time though. It kinda felt like he was reassuring me that he was okay and in a better place. Still to this day.. This song makes me think about everything. Why he was taken so young. All I can come up with is the old saying - the good always die young. Or something to that affect. Because Dusty was a spectacular person. Never in my 29 years met anymore more genuine, caring, talented, and badass as him. Anyway. Hope this doesn't make anyone sad, its not the point. I just had to honestly vent. Even if it is to the "open air" like this text box.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments:
I'm going through a bitter divorce from an abusive partner. This song really hit very close to heart.i feel better listening to the chorus and I did a small dance and even smiled after days of misery.
Thank you Paul Simon, you're a legend!

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: This was the first Paul Simon single I can recall buying. I loved the drums. Growing up in the singer-songwriter era of the early 70's gave me some great songs that would prepare me for adulthood.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: The song has always gave me a weird feeling I've heard it 45 years ago and now that I'm married I completely 100% understand it

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: Heard this for the first time on the radio today. That opening drum line is entrancing!

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: I always appreciated Tony Levin's bass in this groove. He also provided that same kind of funk in Sledgehammer, Shock the Monkey and other Peter Gabriel tunes.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: My dad used to sing this fairly often, especially the line "hop on the bus, Gus" when he and I would take the bus together. I completely forgot about this entirely for many years until this morning when my boss gave my a ride to work really early in the morning just as the sun was coming up. He turned on the radio and this came on and I was like wow, how did I forget about this song.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: My mom actually used to sing this to me and my sisters on our long car rides.back in the 70s.she had a beautiful voice. It seems like a dream..

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover
comments: This is  without doubt a beautiful song and for me one best from Paul Simon.

title: 50 Ways to Leave Your Lover

Paul Gonzales

I remember as a young 19 year old in 1967 on my way to Vietnam in a U.S. Navy ship. Singing this new song and already wishing I was homeward bound. Finally in 1968 when my tour of duty ended came back to America, San Francisco, I kissed the ground when I got off the ship. I was home. Here I am age 75 and how this song brings back memories. Where did the last 55 years go to. One moment I'm a kid and the next moment I'm an elderly man.

title: Girl from the North Country
comments: I remember buying this album a number of years ago in my early teens when I was just getting into vinyl and Dylan. Didn't know any of the songs. I remember it was a cold winter afternoon but the sun was shining when I put this on my turntable for the first time. Bob's voice was so mellow and the lyrics were so bittersweet and I was captivated. Listening to this song just brings back all the memories and feelings I had when I was around that age. Will always love this song the most x

title: You've Got To Hide Your Love Away - Remastered
comments: I feel like this song and era are John at his most Dylan influenced. He said Dylan got him to focus more on the lyrics than just the music/sounds and I feel like Help/Rubber Soul is when John started turning more inwards when it came to his songwriting and writing more from the heart as opposed to just factory made love songs. His vocals are pretty Dylan heavy here too.

title: You've Got To Hide Your Love Away - Remastered
comments: There is something wrong with the audio. I am thankful this video is back up though. It was up on YouTube, years ago...and then disappeared. For years it was gone. Now it is back...but it would be just our luck...the audio is jacked up on it. Oh well. I suppose...when it is The Beatles...we should just feel fortunate we have what we have. What a beautiful piece of work by John. One of his best melodies, and such superb lyrics. A precursor to the great, Rubber Soul album.  Often felt as though...this would have fit perfectly on Rubber Soul.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Video for The Only Living Boy In New York (original) by Simon And Garfunkel. From their 1970 LP Bridge Over Troubled Water

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: God I wish the simplicity and quality of this kind of music could come back

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: This video is fantastic. I love this song but to pair it with views of NYC from circa 1970 is a genius move. It captures the feeling beautifully. Of course the people alive in NYC back then would hardly recognize Manhattan today. It's like an urban Disneyland, made safe for tourists. I woke up with this song in my head and found this video. To whoever did it, thank you.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: The brilliance of this video is the simplicity...the innocence of simple image and a magnificent sound.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Well done. It's one of my favorite S&G songs and the video evokes a feeling of wistfullness.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Clearly, one of their best.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Yes thanks for the well done video it captures the nuance fairly well. I was hoping for a vid of them doing this while young which doesn't seem to exist this will suffice.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: This was one of those records that even though I was only 10 really made me stop and listen. I really loved the harmony and I'd play it over and over in my head long after it had finished. Whenever the radio was on I'd try and will the DJ to play it. I still love listening to it, by far my favourite S&G track. Good times. Special times and we knew it even then. We haven't waited fifty years to realise it. We lived it

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: <- Dutch history teacher. My pupils are busy doing their little tasks. At the background this song is playing. Such a story telling song, great atmosphere in class.

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Beautiful , just beautiful video! Well done!

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: This song has it all...longing..friendship..world city .perfect harmony..perfect guitars...times long gone. A masterpiece without any age

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Beautiful video to accompany a beautiful song!

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: When I was 19 I used get home at 4am lay  in my room high on speed , this album was on a cassette that looped all night into the next day ... me and my pals smoking weed trying to come down , as I got to New York the first time it was in my head everywhere , that city totally stole my heart , .. what a place .. what a crazy place so many good times , this song has been with me since I was knee high since my dad had it on vinyl and I played it then , I‚Äôve never once got tired of it , what a magical song

title: The Only Living Boy in New York
comments: Paul wrote this song in response to being cut from the movie "Catch 22" by Mike Nichols. He had cast Paul and Artie for the movie, but cut Paul's part. Paul still had to write the music and was bitter. Thus began the Simon & Garfunkel feud.

From their movie "The Last Waltz" with The Staple Singers - 

I pulled into Nazareth, I was feelin' about half past dead;
I just need some place where I can lay my head.
"Hey, mister, can you tell me where a man might find a bed?"
He just grinned and shook my hand, and "No!", was all he said.

(Chorus:)
Take a load off Fannie, take a load for free;
Take a load off Fannie, And (and) (and) you can put the load right on me.

I picked up my bag, I went lookin' for a place to hide;
When I saw Carmen and the Devil walkin' side by side.
I said, "Hey, Carmen, come on, let's go downtown."
She said, "I gotta go, but m'friend can stick around."

(Chorus)

Go down, Miss Moses, there's nothin' you can say
It's just ol' Luke, and Luke's waitin' on the Judgement Day.
"Well, Luke, my friend, what about young Anna Lee?"
He said, "Do me a favor, son, woncha stay an' keep Anna Lee company?"

(Chorus)

Crazy Chester followed me, and he caught me in the fog.
He said, "I will fix your rags, if you'll take Jack, my dog."
I said, "Wait a minute, Chester, you know I'm a peaceful man."
He said, "That's okay, boy, won't you feed him when you can."

(Chorus)

Catch a Cannonball, now, t'take me down the line
My bag is sinkin' low and I do believe it's time.
To get back to Miss Annie, you know she's the only one.
Who sent me here with her regards for everyone.

(Chorus)

title: The Weight
comments:
From their movie "The Last Waltz" with The Staple Singers - 

I pulled into Nazareth, I was feelin' about half past dead;
I just need some place where I can lay my head.
"Hey, mister, can you tell me where a man might find a bed?"
He just grinned and shook my hand, and "No!", was all he said.

(Chorus:)
Take a load off Fannie, take a load for free;
Take a load off Fannie, And (and) (and) you can put the load right on me.

I picked up my bag, I went lookin' for a place to hide;
When I saw Carmen and the Devil walkin' side by side.
I said, "Hey, Carmen, come on, let's go downtown."
She said, "I gotta go, but m'friend can stick around."

(Chorus)

Go down, Miss Moses, there's nothin' you can say
It's just ol' Luke, and Luke's waitin' on the Judgement Day.
"Well, Luke, my friend, what about young Anna Lee?"
He said, "Do me a favor, son, woncha stay an' keep Anna Lee company?"

(Chorus)

Crazy Chester followed me, and he caught me in the fog.
He said, "I will fix your rags, if you'll take Jack, my dog."
I said, "Wait a minute, Chester, you know I'm a peaceful man."
He said, "That's okay, boy, won't you feed him when you can."

(Chorus)

Catch a Cannonball, now, t'take me down the line
My bag is sinkin' low and I do believe it's time.
To get back to Miss Annie, you know she's the only one.
Who sent me here with her regards for everyone.

(Chorus)

title: The Weight
comments: Mavis Staples gives me chills every time she sings. That voice is the voice of God.

title: The Weight
comments: Whatever else happens in life, I remain grateful for great music like this.  Peace to you all.

title: The Weight
comments: One of the top musical performances ever. The addition of the Staples Singers really illustrates the connection between classic country, soul and gospel music. This is mother fuckin' AMERICA right here.

title: The Weight
comments: Love how Rick comes in like your drunk uncle at Christmas! So freaking good!

title: The Weight
comments: Believe it or not, I have really just discovered "the band." Never did listen to them back when they were hot, now I'm hooked! Levon is the greatest!

title: The Weight
comments: The Last Waltz. One of Scorsese's underappreciated masterpieces.

title: The Weight
comments: The Staple singers are lifting this song up to a whole new level.  Great to see they enjoyed it very much too.  Mavis starting clapping her hands and whispering "beautiful" in the last second.  priceless.

title: The Weight
comments:
By far the best version of The Weight that has ever been performed.
Thanks for the memories.

title: The Weight
comments: One of the most perfect performances I've ever seen. The harmonies were out of this world.

title: The Weight
comments: This is music at its highest level, in every way possible, writing, performance and sheer passion.

title: The Weight
comments: For me this immensely soulful groove takes on a whole other dimension at 1:01 when Mavis Staples' glorious voice chimes in, and the camera pans over and shows Levon grooving and smiling, knowing that they are creating magic. It doesn't get any better than this.

Sarah Delarosa
1 year ago (edited)
I dedicated this song to my Mom. She committed suicide when I was 15, going on 16. She was only 36 years old. She loved to draw, and she was very good at it, but she never thought she was. She lost her Mom to a heart attack, when she was only 11 years old. She had a VERY hard life, and she never thought she was worth anything to anyone. I'm going on 60 now, and I still miss her. I didn't get to grow up with her because my father kidnapped me and my brothers, and the State found out, and they kidnapped us, and put us in different foster homes. This song brings it all back..., it still brings tears to my eyes. You never stop loving the people you truly care about, and nothing ever fills the empty space they leave in your heart. I write poetry, and I wrote a poem many years ago, called Phyllis.

title: Vincent
comments: Don McLean's Vincent (Starry,Starry Night) Almost all images created by Vincent Van- Gogh. Song by Don McLean I in no way assume any credit for song or images.

title: Vincent
comments: For those who may have missed my previous comments. I compiled and uploaded this so I could explain my love of Van-Gogh's art to a dear friend of mine and thought McLean's Stary Stary Night was perfect in helping to explain. The lyrics were strictly for the benefit of my Friend, who's first language is not English.I never imagined it would get so many views and comments. I'm so glad I was able to share.

title: Vincent
comments: I dedicated this song to my Mom. She committed suicide when I was 15, going on 16. She was only 36 years old. She loved to draw, and she was very good at it, but she never thought she was. She lost her Mom to a heart attack, when she was only 11 years old. She had a VERY hard life, and she never thought she was worth anything to anyone. I'm going on 60 now, and I still miss her. I didn't get to grow up with her because my father kidnapped me and my brothers, and the State found out, and they kidnapped us, and put us in different foster homes. This song brings it all back..., it still brings tears to my eyes. You never stop loving the people you truly care about, and nothing ever fills the empty space they leave in your heart. I write poetry, and I wrote a poem many years ago, called Phyllis.

title: Vincent
comments: This song holds such a powerful message for those suffering from mental illness. Because these are usually the kindest, sweetest and truest among us. They are gifted, many artfully or musically and their works are an expression of the love they hold inside. Like Vincent they too struggle to live in this tough world. Please remember to be kind.

title: Vincent
comments: Not a religious person, but I sincerely hope that the love in this beautiful song reached Vincent somehow, somewhere.

title: Vincent
comments: I was walking in Rome, this beautiful, ancient and poetic city, at night, and heard this magnificient song played through a window, in one of these dark, small, hidden alleys. It was a very magical experience

title: Vincent
comments: No matter how many times I hear this song, it still makes me weep.

title: Vincent
comments: Don McLean, in my opinion, is perhaps America's greatest poet ever. When should listen to him explain the lyrics to American pie. This is a man who not only can sing exquisitely, but a man who can create unmatched beauty in his words. I don't know of any other poet who can move my heart to this degree. What an American treasure. What a treasure to the world.

title: Vincent
comments:
‚ÄúI think the purest of souls, those with the most fragile of hearts, must be meant for a short life. They can't be tethered or held in your palm.



Just like a sparrow, they light on your porch. Their song might be brief, but how greedy would we be to ask for more? No, you cannot keep a sparrow. You can only hope that as they fly away, they take a little bit of you with them.‚Äù

comments: When I was 6 my dad committed suicide and today is his birthday, so I‚Äôm listening to this song. I‚Äôm 6 months pregnant and planned on naming my little boy Vincent long before I knew this song existed. In memory of my late Father, in honor of my future son. I love you both.

title: Vincent
comments: 50 years ago, when I was seven, my mother leapt to her death from our balcony. That leaves a mark, I won‚Äôt lie. Sadness, anger, loneliness. But this beautiful song has helped me understand the unfathomable, at least a little.

title: Vincent
comments: This brings tears to my eyes every time.  I think Don McLean is a true artist, not celebrated enough.  This song was my husband's favourite, we listened to it together so many times.  He passed away a couple of months ago so I listened to it now as often as I can in the hope that he can hear it too

title: Vincent
comments: Today is Vincent's birthday. I first heard this song in my teens and loved the song but wondered who Vincent was. Once I learned the meaning of the song as it relates to Van Gogh's life, I vowed to someday see his paintings in person. Visiting the Van Gogh museum in Amsterdam a few years ago, I had tears in my eyes and a lump in my throat and as I walked through, I felt such a beautiful sadness. My girlfriend who loved to draw and sketch recently committed suicide and now I have an ever deeper understanding of what he was trying to say to me and yes, even more sadness.

title: Vincent
comments: This song really hurts. Both my brother and father committed suicide due to depression. My brother was a painter and a teacher for special needs children. He painted starry night on a canvas just days before he left this world. The only thing that keeps me going is that I know I will see them again one day when the time is up for me. So I will live my life to the fullest ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: In My Life - Remastered
comments: My dad passed from a heart attack very unexpectedly last month. I picked this song to play at his funeral. He loved the Beatles and this song is just so fitting of his life well lived. My dad was one in a million. Loved by everyone. He was the hardest worker I know and loved his wife, four daughters and their husbands and his 6 grandchildren like no other. He never missed a game for any of his daughters or grandchildren. I miss him so much it pains me. Still can‚Äôt believe it.

Elizabeth deVries
2 years ago (edited)
My late husband really admired Bob Dylan, and my husband was quite a man so that says a lot to me in and of itself. He LOVED Bob Dylan. I do too, but now I feel warm but sad when I hear his songs. I want my husband with me and singing along or playing his guitar along with it. Not having him here playing Dylan's songs..........I don't have words how it feels. Others like me will understand. My situation is not unique. He played a lot of Dylan's songs on his Martin. Those are among my favorite times with him. We enjoyed playing and singing Dylan songs and some others minimum 3 times a week. We'd sit across from each other on the sofa, play guitar and singing together! I mean, how awesome is that to do with your hubby!!!  So: THANK YOU Bob, for sharing your genius. I don't think there will be another like Dylan, ever. I am also very grateful Bob wrote some of the most amazing music of all time and because of that, along with the music,  I have these memories of my husband, that are very dear.  It's pretty cool. Peace!

I love this song. It reminds me of a time when I was kinda just drifting around and met a great man. Regardless of his sexuality, age, education level or lifestyle he was a dear friend of mine.... title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: My late husband really admired Bob Dylan, and my husband was quite a man so that says a lot to me in and of itself. He LOVED Bob Dylan. I do too, but now I feel warm but sad when I hear his songs. I want my husband with me and singing along or playing his guitar along with it. Not having him here playing Dylan's songs..........I don't have words how it feels. Others like me will understand. My situation is not unique. He played a lot of Dylan's songs on his Martin. Those are among my favorite times with him. We enjoyed playing and singing Dylan songs and some others minimum 3 times a week. We'd sit across from each other on the sofa, play guitar and singing together! I mean, how awesome is that to do with your hubby!!!  So: THANK YOU Bob, for sharing your genius. I don't think there will be another like Dylan, ever. I am also very grateful Bob wrote some of the most amazing music of all time and because of that, along with the music,  I have these memories of my husband, that are very dear.  It's pretty cool. Peace!

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: I love this song. It reminds me of a time when I was kinda just drifting around and met a great man. Regardless of his sexuality, age, education level or lifestyle he was a dear friend of mine.... He respected my boundaries and never made me feel like I was a bad man and inspired me to let go of all the pain and love and live again. He was gay and I am not, but regardless I loved him as a friend and cherished our time together and all the conversations we had. I never knew he was a dying man and I didn't want to believe it whe he said he'd be dead by the time I graduated from college. 3 years later I came home after graduation and was applying to pharmacy school and find out he'd past away. I'm in my P1 year and honestly if I'd never met him.... I don't think i would have ever got my head back from out the clouds and clean up my life and get focused. I miss you Roger LaPrade, this is for you. God bless you may you rest in peace! I can still you smiling singing this with me still my friend. Until we meet again... RIP

comments: Your music was and is my shelter from the storm(s)!‚≠ê

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: I've listened to this album a hundred times over. Each time I am more amazed than the last. I see the stories in my mind as the songs play. Thanks Bob.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: Listened to this on my first trip to Mexico in 75.  Still remember driving through the Sonoran desert with the full moon shining.  The desert glowed as I began my 27 year sojourn as an international gypsy.   Eventually came to realize the answers were all waiting for me inside.  Still enjoy experiencing different culture, language, landscapes, foods, world views, and so much more.  "I'm sailing away my own true love.  I'm sailing away in the morning...."

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: To this day...I still can't listen to this song without tearing up.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: I can‚Äôt hear this song without weeping. It hurts so much. Sometimes I feel so lost in it. Like a life once lived but then crushed by malice and hate. The malice and hate was me. It was the song that was life. It always was. And I feel like I missed it somehow. And that‚Äôs what makes me sad.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: Breathtaking poetry /songwriting i just love Dylans voice

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: This album was played at bedtime every night for a lot of years. Our two  now adult children are Dylan fans. We brought them up well.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: Have always loved this song. It especially fit during the end credits of the movie St.Vincent with Bill Murray. A criminally underrated movie.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: This album got me through many a lonely night driving from town to town across this great country and I still love every song on this it is absolutely my favorite

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: When my marriage ended this song came on and I broke down.  I can never remember crying like that from a song but it just resonated with me at that time

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: When I was 18 I suffered a drug overdose, I was in a field and collapsed, I pulled myself to a tree and thought my life was over. I was so frightened. I put on this song waiting for the end. That was 11 years ago. I'm still listening to this song.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: This is genius, lyrics, rhythm, message, emotion, delivery. Play it again üòä

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: I first heard this in high school when it was released. His 60s stuff is embedded in my soul, but this album  still makes my heart twist & tumble. Listen on head/ear phones.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: The magic of this song is the definition of a storm can vary depending on the soul but the message remains the same. If you have a supporting hand then life feels so much brighter.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: Man,  without fail when I think I'm not feeling deep enuff, I get automatic goosebumps. Forever greatful for such powerful music, in such a time.

title: Shelter from the Storm
comments: One of music‚Äôs most beautiful love songs man. Guitar, bass, harmonica - no tricks, no frills, just buckets of sorrow and unparalleled songwriting ability. Dylan was genius.

7 years ago
I recently played this for a friend that had never heard of Nick. She had no idea what his story was. I asked her to listen, give me feedback, then I would tell her about him. How astute she was in her response! "Why", she asked, "do I feel a hidden threat in this song/poem?" THAT is the power of a good poet! Of course there is threat here: below the radar, beneath the words. He's only days from taking his own life. That must be resonating beneath his consciousness. And it communicated, in this beautiful poem/song, to a woman who would hear him for the first time, come to know who he was,  more than 40 years after he left. That is amazing to me. That is the mark of a real poet.

jamesdeansghost55
7 months ago (edited)
By the time Drake recorded this in the fall of '71 he had retreated so deeply into his own world of self isolation and depression. He quietly and discreetly recorded this with just the sound engineer over a two night period. The record label was not even aware he had recorded it. One day he walked into the Island Records office to deliver the master tapes but just sat on a bench quietly until an office personnel noticed him and invited him upstairs for a cup of tea. Drake never mentioned the new recordings and the office guy wasn't aware of any new music so Drake just sat there for a half hour not speaking and then left. On his way out the door he put the master tapes on the front desk and walked away for good. It was a while before anyone even noticed the tapes were there. Drake's involvement with post production was extremely minimal due to his deteriorating condition. He never promoted it or played it for an audience.

title: Pink Moon
comments:
Lyric:

I saw it written and I saw it say
Pink moon is on its way
And none of you stand so tall
Pink moon gonna get you all
It's a pink moon
It's a pink, pink, pink, pink, pink moon.

title: Pink Moon
comments: For anyone listening to this for the first time: congrats, you won

title: Pink Moon
comments: Nick Drake is the Vincent Van Gogh of music, he had to die before anyone realized his brilliance.

title: Pink Moon
comments: Every time there is a Pink Moon, like tonight , millions of people must think of Nick Drake and the melancholy power of his great song, which is about him and about everyone, in those words.  His work is like a tree, static and rooted, in his short life, yet always able to move its myriad branches and its whole trunk, in the slightest breeze, for all of us to enjoy.

title: Pink Moon
comments: Some guy on a train randomly struck up a conversation with me and told me to listen to this. I thought it was kind of strange, but for some reason, it all makes sense to me now. Thanks, random person on the train with a cane.

title: Pink Moon
comments: I remember the night I first heard this song, a musician myself in my twenties, cutting my teeth in the Austin, Texas music scene. The clubs had all closed down, and the night owls went to a 24 hour cafe called Magnolia Cafe near a lake. I got a seat by the window; ordered pancakes and was staring up at a full moon with pink clouds blowing across it, the kind you see in Austin because of the reflection of the city lights on the atmosphere. Pink Moon came on the sound system. I will never forget.

title: Pink Moon
comments: they don't make em like that any more....

title: Pink Moon
comments: I wish Nick could somehow know that he's nowadays reaching out to so many great people, who love him and his music - and I wish also that it happened before he died. That would have brought him happiness and comfort.

title: Pink Moon
comments: The piano notes drop down like a soft evening shower. Awesome!!!!

title: Pink Moon
comments: When I was still in the womb my mom used to play this song and she said she swears I danced, and when I was born it would stop me from crying, now when I listen to this it helps me sleep. This song has an emotional connection to me if u would put it that way I guess

title: Pink Moon
comments: 12:49am July 29, 2021 I'm writing this comment. I had an emotional conversation with my dad about my own personal hell I've gone through these past couple weeks, decided randomly after all was said and done to listen to this album for the first time. I know nothing about Nick Drake other than he has a couple albums. After listening through it and coming back to the first track, I felt what I can only describe as love.

title: Pink Moon
comments: if you've ever tried to play a nick drake song, you know how talented he was

title: Pink Moon
comments: Nick Drake was an original guitarist/songwriter who burned out way too early in his life. His confused and troubled mind reflected a depression that he could no longer live with. He left us some beautiful, dark ballads along his brief life's path that to this day are often copied but totally unmatched in their originality.

title: Pink Moon
comments: one of those songs that just walks right up to your soul and pokes it

title: Pink Moon
comments: I recently played this for a friend that had never heard of Nick. She had no idea what his story was. I asked her to listen, give me feedback, then I would tell her about him. How astute she was in her response! "Why", she asked, "do I feel a hidden threat in this song/poem?" THAT is the power of a good poet! Of course there is threat here: below the radar, beneath the words. He's only days from taking his own life. That must be resonating beneath his consciousness. And it communicated, in this beautiful poem/song, to a woman who would hear him for the first time, come to know who he was,  more than 40 years after he left. That is amazing to me. That is the mark of a real poet.

title: Pink Moon
comments:
June 19, 1948. Nick would've been 63 today. I read that he told his mother, "If my music ever did anything for one person, it would be worth it." Seeing that this video has nearly 500k views, I bet he is smiling.
Happy Birthday, Nick.

comments: By the time Drake recorded this in the fall of '71 he had retreated so deeply into his own world of self isolation and depression. He quietly and discreetly recorded this with just the sound engineer over a two night period. The record label was not even aware he had recorded it. One day he walked into the Island Records office to deliver the master tapes but just sat on a bench quietly until an office personnel noticed him and invited him upstairs for a cup of tea. Drake never mentioned the new recordings and the office guy wasn't aware of any new music so Drake just sat there for a half hour not speaking and then left. On his way out the door he put the master tapes on the front desk and walked away for good. It was a while before anyone even noticed the tapes were there. Drake's involvement with post production was extremely minimal due to his deteriorating condition. He never promoted it or played it for an audience.

title: Pink Moon
comments: This album is now 50 years old, and it's my favorite album. There's something about Nick's voice, the complex guitar, the general noise of the old recording technology, and the understated lyrics that make this album so personal to me. It feels like Nick is a friend or some sort of prophet offering equivocal poetry as counsel, while playing his pacifying guitar. This album is the ambience of my bedroom which houses me and exclusively me‚Äîwell, me and the apparition of Nick.

title: Pink Moon
comments: I first heard this song 2 weeks ago. What is weird is that i heard it randomly on a playlist on spotify and at the time i thought it was a brand new song, it sounded so recent and modern to my ears, a complete challenge to the status quo of classical guitar music. When i found out it was written nearly 50 years ago by a guy who committed suicide shortly after writing it i had shivers. Im now obsessed by it and Nick drake continues to blow my mind. A musician born before his time.

title: Landslide
comments:
You're watching the official music video for Fleetwood Mac - "Landslide" from the 1975 album "Fleetwood Mac". The new Fleetwood Mac collection '50 Years ‚Äì Don‚Äôt Stop' is available now. Get your copy here https://lnk.to/FM50 and check out North American tour dates below to see if the band is coming to a town near you.

title: Landslide
comments: One of the greatest songs ever written Ô∏è

title: Landslide
comments: Its April 1st my mom passed exactly 2 hours ago and I played this song outside her home as they took her away. Thank you Stevie for this beautiful song, she lived a wonderful 89 years.

title: Landslide
comments: This was one of my son's favourite songs even though it came out when i was young. His father and i took him to see Fleetwood Mac in Perth Australia and he loved it. He suffered from severe depression and we lost him in August 21. We played this at his funeral and it reminds me of his dad half carrying him out of the  concert as he'd suffered nerve damage in one of his attempts to end his life. We fought valiantly to keep him in this world but it caught us by surprise when he was in a great place. He died in his sleep. I think he was too pure and good for this world. My heart is broken. This song was played at his funeral and it was the hardest time. I miss him every day.

title: Landslide
comments: Stevie Nicks has one of the most haunting voices. She gives me chills. It takes a special talent and a pure gift to sound like her.

title: Landslide
comments:
2022 and this song/singer still going strong. 
Proves the real classics will never die

title: Landslide
comments: I'm sitting here crying cause my wife of 45 years just passed 2 months ago and this was one of our favorites. Love you to the moon   honey

title: Landslide
comments: I used to sing this at the top of my lungs to my husband Damon. 15 years of marriage and 4 kids later he was killed on his way to work one day 4 days after Christmas. Now I sing it to my children and miss the man we built our life around. Learning to continue on without you is the hardest. Damon, the children are getting older....RIP forever 37

title: Landslide
comments: My son is on Life support because of a skateboarding accident. This is his favorite song! I've played it at his bedside and he opened his eyes for a minute. Stevie Has healed, touched many lives. She is an Angel

title: Landslide
comments: I just lost my partner of 25 years. He loved this song too. Will be forever our tune. Bless you Fleetwood Mac for this lovely song xxx

title: Landslide
comments: Sometimes, the world creates a song that will never be forgotten. It will always be just as powerful as the first time you've heard it and the thousandth time you've heard it. This is one of those songs.

title: Landslide
comments: I used to listen to this song and just dream of escaping the abusive relationship I was in. I think the fact I can listen to this song without crying now means I'm in a better place in life

title: Landslide
comments:

comments: My daughters picked this song out for my wife's funeral, she was hit by a car while running at the age of 48. I cry everytime I hear it

title: Landslide

Famously, footsteps were made by Paul as he played guitar. George Martin didn't like this idea and was more in favour of beeps at random intervals. The pair were at loggerheads over which direction to go in. Eventually McCartney won out, but did agree to record a version with the beeps which influenced a young Brian Eno who was pottering about in the studio. It was released on limited edition vinyl and finally unearthed by 'Just a Beatles fan'.

title: Blackbird - Remastered 2009
comments: Famously, footsteps were made by Paul as he played guitar. George Martin didn't like this idea and was more in favour of beeps at random intervals. The pair were at loggerheads over which direction to go in. Eventually McCartney won out, but did agree to record a version with the beeps which influenced a young Brian Eno who was pottering about in the studio. It was released on limited edition vinyl and finally unearthed by 'Just a Beatles fan'.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: I just turned 66 and I am so thankful that I grew up with some of the greatest music ever written and performed by the the best musicians in the world.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: Peter, Paul and Mary?  Wonderful , 2 guitars , 3 voices,  3 wonderful talents.  The best music anyone can hear, nobody can get close to them! üòò

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: No matter what other people say, PP&M were the best at vocal harmonies. And this song was one of Dylan's best...

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: I'm an old man over 60 years old, and it's my daily routine to watch the video of Paul's main performance in Japan and sing along with him every day with a guitar in my hand, but even after listening to it many times, I'm still amazed at Paul's deep and artistic singing skills. Of course, it goes without saying that Peter and Marie's skills are also amazing.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: After more than 50 years, never tired of this song!  Thanks, P,P, andM, and to writer Bob Dylan!

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: They were the music of my youth. They gave me a moral compass. I‚Äôll die soon, their music will be in my mind and give me peace.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments:
They were the best folk group ever
formed!  Big songs Big hearts Big souls!

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: Magical... They were just wonderful in concert. I remember them signing autographs and talking to fans for 2 hours after a 3 hour concert. They just loved the younger fans, stocking up the next generation. Mary always marveled at the grandkids of their early fans. They were in love with music, and all they could do with it. Peter and Paul wrote a few standards. The Wedding Song by Peter, and Day Is Done by Paul. Standards. Their guitars and their harmony were as strong as any folk singers.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: P.P & Mary were  the best trio ever ! Also talented as  the duo Everly Brothers or Simon and Garfunkel . This performance "Dont Think Twice" is by far  better than the original  performed  even by Bob Dylan ! It's just PERFECTION !

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: This is an astounding version of an incredible song (with Dylan just 22 when writing it).  I love the guitar solo that Peter does at the opening and have based my playing of it mostly on that wonderful instrumental.  Perfect singing too.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments:
I felt a strong power from their heart of music 
More than any rock bands,

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: Iconic. Where have the years gone. Lord, this song is perfection. Two perfect guitars, three part harmony, great song! The 3 of you had a way of complimenting each other. It is a gift. Saw you many times over the years. Wedding Song, and Day is Done are a couple of your best contributions. Mary will always be missed. She was special, as we all are....

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments:
Such fine music......
God knows what He is doing, that's for sure

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: I've been a fan of all kinds of music but folk music such as this great trio performed  is probably my seconf favorite, following the blues which makes Eric Laptons version my favorite.

title: Don't Think Twice, It's All Right
comments: Goosebumps - from measure 1.  Arrigato Kazuyuki-san for finding & posting this.

comments: Its such a shame we don't have singers like this anymore. WE need more story telling singers. Miss them dearly.........

comments: I've been practicing this song like crazy on my guitar!!! Wonderful finger pickin"

comments: One of Bob Dylan's greatest songs beautifully performed by Peter, Paul and the late Mary Traverse.

title: The Boxer
comments: This is February 2021. I listen to this song and others and it takes back more than 50 years ago at age 19 on my way to the Vietnam war sailing on a Navy ship and so much uncertainty. Just a kid.  Now I'm 74 years old still listening to all these songs of the 60s. Miss my youth.

title: The Boxer
comments: I was at this concert and remember the audience "singing" the cymbal crashes. Half a million people imitating a cymbal was surreal. It doesn't come through on the video but it was simply amazing in real life.

title: The Boxer
comments: Two men, one guitar and only their pure voices...that's magical. Hell yeah, I miss those  days when everything in music is so pure and spiritual.

title: The Boxer
comments: Unbelievable how these two sing together as one. In my opinion about the greatest duo ever put together.

title: The Boxer
comments: After changes upon changes we hear this music and are forever changed.

title: The Boxer
comments: These harmonies will never be duplicated  or matched it was a magical time.

title: The Boxer
comments: I am old at 63  but would not change my age for I lived through the best music we will ever know...and as Simon and Garfunkel, I can say I love them as much as the Beatles...their ability to tell a story and  grab your. heart is  unique...they dont make songs like this anymore...enjoy younger generations,

title: The Boxer
comments: This song is pure genius - the way it was written just draws a person in so deeply.

title: The Boxer
comments: They personified a generation, but wow are they incredible together. Never gets old or stale. Timeless.

title: The Boxer
comments: If you're watching this in 2021, I love you and you're not alone.

title: The Boxer
comments: It was good to see Garfunkel reach out and rub Paul‚Äôs back. Like, ‚Äú you did good brother. Look what we created with the songs you wrote‚Äù.  I don‚Äôt know what came between these two men, but they can never deny that combined they were gold. And, I love Paul‚Äôs smile. I don‚Äôt think either of them aren‚Äôt fully aware of the mark on history this concert and their talents made.

title: The Boxer
comments: I was there. My brother and I snuck out from our house in Bath Beach, Brooklyn. I was 11 years old and it‚Äôs still one of my greatest memories.

title: The Boxer
comments: Paul smiles, glances at Art, Art puts his hand on Paul‚Äôs back....for a moment all is right in the world.

title: The Boxer
comments: This was one of the best concerts in the history of mankind.

title: The Boxer
comments: Glad that they included the "lost" verse here.The way their voices blend is just transcendent.

title: The Boxer
comments: Paul Simon is one of the great singer/song writers of the rock generation,   Art was one of the most beautiful voices ever.  What a combination!!!

title: The Boxer
comments: This totally epic.  You will never see a duet that is so perfect together.  The song writing and their voices was off the charts.  And all they used was a guitar.  That is pure Bliss

title: The Boxer
comments: I'm an Australian who has never been overseas yet every time I hear this song - it makes me long to go to New York and experience what they speak of here. Such a beautiful and timeless song from two men whose music I have been playing lately to my 5 year old twin boys so they can understand what music is and what it should be.

title: The Boxer
comments: Paul Simon, absolutely one of the greatest songwriters.

title: The Boxer
comments: Mind-blowing how 2 magical people stand in front of everywhere, stripped down without drums, distortion, beats, etc etc... And stand there performing actual legendary tunes made by themselves . The calm, the bravery... Let alone how serene these 2 are in unison.    As unique as it gets.

title: The Boxer
comments: Listening to Simon and Garfunkel is just like hearing two angels sing. No matter how bad things are, or how low I'm feeling, their music always transports me to a far better place. Absolutely beautiful.

title: The Boxer
comments: The heavenly harmony of these two artist is like none other. I feel blessed they shared it with me!‚ù£Ô∏è‚úåÔ∏è

title: The Boxer
comments: I remember listening to this song on our small transistor radio with my elder sisters in the early 70‚Äôs.What a bliss it was now l understand‚Ä¶.

title: The Boxer
comments: I‚Äôm 65, this is one of the most hauntingly beautiful songs I can think of. We of our age are blessed. We enjoyed the music of the ‚Äò60s, ‚Äò70s, and ‚Äò80s. I do appreciate the music of today, I‚Äôm not fussy, beautiful music is timeless, but for me, our time presented the best you could hope for.

title: The Boxer

title: The Boxer
comments: It doesn't get any better than this!!!! My generation had some AWESOME music to grow up with. These guys are poets....absolute poets of life!!!

title: The Boxer
comments: I saw them 12 years ago shortly after they re-reconciled and despite them being older it was the best concert I've been to. Great music, and they each did a solo section in the middle so it was 3 hours of continuous music. They must have enjoyed it themselves as they did a third encore song after the house lights were turned on. Although they were nearly 70 they still had great voices and so many great songs.

title: The Boxer
comments: This is definitely among the top 10 greatest and most poetically beautiful songs ever written and performed. I loved how they added and extra line to this song for this performance. I  mean, who hasn‚Äôt felt like the Boxer at some when life beats us down?

title: The Boxer
comments: My god, this song and this version simply overwhelm me on so many levels. If only the world could have stood still...forever

title: The Boxer
comments: A gente, muitos de n√≥s, amar√° esses caras para a vida toda. Eles s√£o demais!

title: The Boxer
comments: I am 62 years young! I have see these guys live and wow, what a music! Two guys and a guitar! The purity of the voice, lyrics beyond compare! Thank God I was born in the right era!

title: The Boxer

title: The Boxer

title: The Boxer
comments: I'm still a pup at 53. This song as well as so many others has been a companion through out my encounters of this motley drama we consider life. Beautiful.

Lyrics:

Helplessly hoping her harlequin hovers
Nearby awaiting a word
Gasping at glimpses of gentle true spirit
He runs wishing he could fly
Only to trip at the sound of goodbye

Wordlessly watching he waits by the window
And wonders at the empty place inside
Heartlessly helping himself to her bad dreams
He worries did he hear a goodbye?
Or even hello?

They are one person
They are two alone
They are three together
They are for each other

Stand by the stairway you'll see something certain
To tell you confusion has its cost
Love isn't lying it's loose in a lady
Who lingers saying she is lost
And choking on hello

They are one person
They are two alone
They are three together
They are for each other

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
Lyrics:

Helplessly hoping her harlequin hovers
Nearby awaiting a word
Gasping at glimpses of gentle true spirit
He runs wishing he could fly
Only to trip at the sound of goodbye

Wordlessly watching he waits by the window
And wonders at the empty place inside
Heartlessly helping himself to her bad dreams
He worries did he hear a goodbye?
Or even hello?

They are one person
They are two alone
They are three together
They are for each other

Stand by the stairway you'll see something certain
To tell you confusion has its cost
Love isn't lying it's loose in a lady
Who lingers saying she is lost
And choking on hello

They are one person
They are two alone
They are three together
They are for each other

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: A moment of silence for the people still searching for this song.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: RIP Joel Miller. This is the last song he played on his guitar. You will never ever be forgotten :( :( :(

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: This is literally one of the most beautiful songs in the world

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I am here for Annihilation. This was the song played while the main character is painting their bedroom wall. Very good music.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Joel was helplessly hoping for Ellie‚Äôs forgiveness. At least he heard that Ellie was willing to try

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
"But . . . I would like to try."
"I'd like that."

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Few perfect songs exist. This is one of them.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
If somehow the lord gave me a second chance at that moment...
" i would do it all over again"

-Joel Miller

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Rest In Peace Joel Miller. The father everyone wants

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: My father loved this song. He played it once and told me about the first time he heard this song. He was a sophomore in high school, he went to his first party that year, at the principals house (hell of a place, right?). Typical 70's party. Beer, weed, and great music. The main thing was that the party holders LOVED Crosby, Stills, and Nash. They had this album playing the entire time. This song always took him back to the first time he heard it, at that party, wishing he could be a kid again.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Watched "Annihilation" yesterday and rediscovered this heartbreakingly beautiful song, which I loved first in the very early 70s. Going back thru & listening to the album. The elegant harmonies and simple acoustic guitar...I'm singing along in my creaky old voice. So pleased that a younger generation has been introduced to this timeless song. Such love!

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
Instantly transported to playing pool with my father with this record on the turntable.

Love you, dad.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I grew up singing this as a 3 part harmony with my mom and brother

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Listen to this masterpiece trough my 27 years, but especially now in Coronavirus quarantine time it feels special.. Love to all from Italy ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: The lyrics of this song is just such beautiful poetry.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
"ill see you around"
"yep"
omg this last conversation :'(

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: My dad recently passed at age 51 and this is mine and his song. It reminds me of my dad so much

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: This song brings tears you didn‚Äôt even know were there.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
[Intro. (Acoustic Guitar)]

Helplessly hoping her harlequin hovers nearby
Awaiting a word

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
This song basically explains the journey Joel and Ellie went on together
They are like one person - they share the same experiences
2 alone - Most of the people they ever loved left them 
Free together- Before Ellie found out, they loved eachothers company inside

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: The most beautiful song ever written. Hands down.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I highly encourage anyone listening to this. Really listen to it. Put on headphones, turn the lights down and hear the 3 distinct sounds of each vocalist. It is one of the most beautiful songs ever written and really appreciating what each vocalist brings to the harmony of their voices is incredible

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: One of the perfect harmonies I've ever heard. One o the treasures World still hides for the most

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
The fact that this was the last song played by Joel, and how the lyrics reflect his condition after losing Ellie is just amazing.

'Love isn't lying it's loose in a lady'

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I have always loved this song.  Harmony, alliteration, beauty, longing.  Wish there was more of this today.  Thank you, Stephen Stills.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: The greatest use of lyrical alliteration in the history of songwriting. The song is perfect!

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I listen to this five times in a row even after all these years. Sweet harmony

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Came across this song for the first time in 50 years, today-  Never fails to turn the waterworks on.  Magnificent lyrics.  Love the alliterations like "Helplessly hoping her harlequin hovers." "Wordlessly watching he waits by the window." Just a beautiful song,

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
This song has a new meaning for me now.
Joel, we gonna miss you... Rest In Peace.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I still tear up at the beauty of the harmonies .

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Just totally helplessly cried my eyes out hearing this for the first time. And no, I wasn't even watching Annihilation (but I will watch is ASAP, seeing all the comments :) ). Didn't know this could still happen to me... Just turned 39 and can't remember the last time I teared up like this. What an insanely powerful song.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Every time I hear this masterpiece I focus on one of the voices. Hear a different song each time. 3 part harmony is perfected with these guys.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Crosby is all over the place, he really does bring these harmonies together

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
Que m√∫sica perfeita!

R.I.P. Joel ‚ù§

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I didnt know this song existed until Home Free covered it and had me standing in the kitchen bawling my eyes out.  I finally came to listen to the original.  Same effect.  Hauntingly, tragically beautiful.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: Absolutely beautiful !  I love this song. Those CS&N harmonies are gorgeous!

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments:
They are One Person
They are Two Alone
They are Three Together
They are For Each Other.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: What a beautiful song. Sometimes you stubble on diamonds, like this one. Happy I did!

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: This beautiful song never fails in bringing me to tears.

title: Helplessly Hoping - 2005 Remaster
comments: I grew up in the 70's under the shadow of my older Sister who has long passed away. I have been moved to a new place since hearing this song, possibly of a time when I looked after her but could never save her.

This performance of ‚ÄòYour Song‚Äô was Elton‚Äôs second appearance on Top Of The Pops, airing on January 14th 1971. This was just one week before the song became his first-ever entry on the UK Singles Chart. Taken from Elton‚Äôs eponymous second UK album, the now classic ballad peaked at #7 and spent 10 weeks inside the Top 40. This performance, recorded at the BBC Television Centre, features band members Nigel Olsson on drums and Dee Murray on bass.

‚ÄúPeace Train‚Äù ‚Äì Yusuf / Cat Stevens‚Äô timeless anthem of hope and unity ‚Äì was originally released on the classic album 'Teaser and the Firecat' in 1971 and was Stevens‚Äô first US Top 10 hit, reaching number 7 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. This Song Around The World version features more than 25 musicians from 12 countries and unites Yusuf / Cat Stevens, singing and playing a beautiful white piano in a tranquil open air setting in Istanbul, Turkey, with musicians such as five time Grammy Award winning blues/americana artist Keb‚Äô Mo‚Äô; Grammy nominated Senegalese artist Baaba Maal; Silkroad‚Äôs Rhiannon Giddens‚Äîalso a Grammy Award winner; Ghassan Birumi playing the oud in Ramallah, Palestine; musicians from the Silkroad Ensemble in Rhinebeck, New York; Pat Simmons (The Doobie Brothers) and James ‚ÄúHutch‚Äù Hutchinson (bass player with Bonnie Raitt) performing in Maui, Hawaii; and bringing together conflict regions with Tushar Lall playing the harmonium in Delhi, India, and Joshua Amjad playing the Kartaal in Karachi, Pakistan.

"Everyone jump upon the Peace Train" and let's make this world a better place. Happy International Day of Peace. One Love!!!

title: Peace Train
comments:
‚ÄúPeace Train‚Äù ‚Äì Yusuf / Cat Stevens‚Äô timeless anthem of hope and unity ‚Äì was originally released on the classic album 'Teaser and the Firecat' in 1971 and was Stevens‚Äô first US Top 10 hit, reaching number 7 on the Billboard Hot 100 chart. This Song Around The World version features more than 25 musicians from 12 countries and unites Yusuf / Cat Stevens, singing and playing a beautiful white piano in a tranquil open air setting in Istanbul, Turkey, with musicians such as five time Grammy Award winning blues/americana artist Keb‚Äô Mo‚Äô; Grammy nominated Senegalese artist Baaba Maal; Silkroad‚Äôs Rhiannon Giddens‚Äîalso a Grammy Award winner; Ghassan Birumi playing the oud in Ramallah, Palestine; musicians from the Silkroad Ensemble in Rhinebeck, New York; Pat Simmons (The Doobie Brothers) and James ‚ÄúHutch‚Äù Hutchinson (bass player with Bonnie Raitt) performing in Maui, Hawaii; and bringing together conflict regions with Tushar Lall playing the harmonium in Delhi, India, and Joshua Amjad playing the Kartaal in Karachi, Pakistan.

"Everyone jump upon the Peace Train" and let's make this world a better place. Happy International Day of Peace. One Love!!!

title: Peace Train
comments: I was crying a mere 30 seconds in, not only because it was so beautiful to see and hear this song played by so many diverse artists or because I wish so much we could have peace, but because I also remember when this song first came out and it hit me hard just how very little things have changed over the decades since. It feels as if no time has passed, and we‚Äôre older, but not at all wiser. But I still hope for better every single day. Peace. üïäüíô

title: Peace Train
comments: A tip of the hat to the people who mix these tracks, who take recordings from musicians all over the globe and blend them so seamlessly. The production manages to weave all the performances into a unified whole, where every voice and instrument is heard, and given prominence at the proper time, yet each serves the purpose of serving the song. Our song.

title: Peace Train
comments: Playing for Change should be nominated and win the Nobel Prize for Peace!

title: Peace Train
comments:

comments: Beautifully brilliant - I started to cry when Yusuf came in. What a beautiful soul, amazing message and wonderful production. We need more of this in the world today. Peace my friends‚Ä¶

title: Peace Train
comments: We need this song and this movement more than ever. Peace!

title: Peace Train
comments: As a lifelong musician for over 60 years, I have always believed and also experienced; that music is truly universal and brings people together. "Playing for a change" shows first hand that this belief is alive and well. Thanks to all of the world musicians, artists, sound and visual engineers, and everyone involved who makes this possible through the magic of the internet and their love of the music.

title: Peace Train
comments: These vids provoke smiles of joy & tears of happiness simultaneously. Music truly is the universal language. All aboard!!!!!

title: Peace Train
comments: While Russia is invading Ukraine the world needs this more than ever. Maybe peace goes have a chance if we keep making marvellous music together. Thanks for the hope. üôèüèº‚òØÔ∏è

title: Peace Train
comments: Folks say that this song is as relevant as when it was written - and yes, I have been hearing this for 50 years now. I disagree. It is MORE RELEVANT THAN EVER. Anybody who cannot shed a tear to this anthem is just not alive. Thank you, Yusuf, for music that transcends generations, and will for generations to come - if we don't destroy ourselves first. PEACE. ‚úåÔ∏è

Thank You Yusuf for coming out of the shadows and back into a light that all can see.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments:
"Ruby Tuesday" by The Rolling Stones 
Composers: Mick Jagger, Keith Richards 

Lyrics:
She would never say where she came from
Yesterday don‚Äôt matter if it‚Äôs gone
While the sun is bright
Or in the darkest night
No one knows
She comes and goes

Goodbye, Ruby Tuesday
Who could hang a name on you?
When you change with every new day
Still, I‚Äôm gonna miss you

Don‚Äôt question why she needs to be so free
She‚Äôll tell you it‚Äôs the only way to be
She just can‚Äôt be chained
To a life where nothing‚Äôs gained
And nothing‚Äôs lost
At such a cost

Goodbye, Ruby Tuesday
Who could hang a name on you?
When you change with every new day
Still, I‚Äôm gonna miss you

‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no time to lose,‚Äù I heard her say
Catch your dreams before they slip away
Dying all the time
Lose your dreams and 
you will lose your mind
Ain‚Äôt life unkind?

Goodbye, Ruby Tuesday
Who could hang a name on you?
When you change with every new day
Still, I‚Äôm gonna miss you

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: I'm happy to live in the world where the Rolling Stones exist.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: This song is an arrow in my heart. When my daughter left home and was on her own, I played this every day, I couldn't stop myself, and cried every time. "Don't question why she needs to be so free/She'll tell you it's the only way to be." It still brings tears - and now SHE is preparing for HER daughter to leave home and be on her own. "When you change with every new day/Still I'm gonna miss you." This is just one beautiful song, a masterpiece.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: RIP My Mom. We played this song at her funeral. Died at the young age of 56 in 2015. This is her song.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: Sleep peacefully Charlie. Thanks for all the music. RIP.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: The early Stones had more great songs in a few years than most bands did in a career.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: I'm 16 right now and I've loved the stones my whole (although short) life . Keith and Mick are the main reason I'm following my dream to become a guitarist

title: Ruby Tuesday

comments: This song is just so beautiful and perfect on so many levels. From Brian‚Äôs recorder part, to Jack‚Äôs piano, the lyrical content. The melody is like a nursery rhyme‚Ä¶it stays with you for your entire life.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: There are songs that everyone hears growing up, songs throughout their life that are magical, and as the years pass, they never tire of hearing them.  This is one of those songs.  A Magical Musical Masterpiece- Perfection.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: We loved you Charlie. Thank you so much for being the backbeat to our youth.

title: Ruby Tuesday
comments: My old dogs name was Ruby, she was born on a Tuesday, we bought her on a Tuesday and for some reason whenever this song came on she looked a little bit happier. When she passed I listened to this song everyday to remember all the happiness in my life to not take anything for granted because it will all be gone one day and on that day you could be dead, alive. So always remember if your having a bad day there is always happiness in something and don't take that happiness for granted.
